items.content_html: This PR adds a bug link to api.SVGImageElement.crossOrigin for Chromium's planned implementation, as requested in #16962 (comment).
items.title: Add bug link to api.SVGImageElement.crossOrigin

items.content_html:
This PR updates and corrects the real values for Safari (Desktop and iOS/iPadOS) for the Animation API, based upon results from the mdn-bcd-collector project (v6.0.8).

Tests Used: https://mdn-bcd-collector.appspot.com/tests/api/Animation

Check out the collector's guide on how to review this PR.

Note: due to issues with update-bcd, these changes were performed manually by comparing the results output for Safari 10.0 and 10.1.
items.title: Update Safari versions for Animation API

items.content_html:
This PR adds a version number for Deno for api.Performance.timeOrigin and api.Performance.toJSON.

source: https://deno.com/blog/v1.22#performancetimeorigin-and-performancetojson
items.title: fix: deno supports performance.timeorigin and performance.tojson

items.content_html: This has been reverted in WebKit/WebKit@e4b63be
items.title: Unprefixed user-select not in Safari 16

items.content_html:
Safari 15.4 now supports the 2-value syntax for background-position-x/background-position-y

See: https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=202148 for testcase and bug fix.
items.title: background-position-* 2-value syntax support in Safari 15.4

items.content_html:
That Chrome 60 is correct is confirmed with this test:
http://mdn-bcd-collector.appspot.com/tests/api/HTMLIFrameElement/allow

Web Confluence also supports the same for Chrome Android:
#6526

Finally, this matches the html.elements.iframe.allow data.
items.title: Update versions for iframe's reflected allow property

items.content_html:
FF103 adds support for serializing native error classes in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1556604#c33

Note that

  • this supports both standard and non-standard error properties (name, message, cause, fileName, lineNumber and columnNumber). The stack property is still only supported in nightly.
  • it works for all the normal error types except for InternalError
  • AggregateError support is in FF but this is not yet in spec so that is added but marked as "non-standard". This includes the errors field.
  • I added info about the supported properties as a Note rather than as properties because the spec is fairly loose about what needs to be supported - essentially it is name + message + "any interesting properties.

Related docs work can be tracked in #18208
items.title: FF103 Errors are serializable (support structuredClone)

items.content_html: This PR simplifies all of the BCD statements with multiple statements that only have notes (no prefix, alternative_name, flags, etc.). Fixes the issues reported in #17005.
items.title: Simplify multiple support statements with just notes

items.content_html:
Update Firefox support for FileSystemEntry's getParent()

Confirmed by testing in Firefox 51 and 52:
https://mdn-bcd-collector.appspot.com/tests/api/FileSystemEntry/getParent

Also supported by the tracking bug:
https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1284987

Part of #6526.
items.title: Update Firefox support for FileSystemEntry's getParent()

items.content_html: This PR is a follow-up to #16594 that adds an upstream_version property to the browser JSON and moves the manual mapping of Safari to Safari iOS into the browser JSON.
items.title: Add upstream_version browser key; move Safari iOS mapping to browser JSON

items.content_html:
This was removed in Chromium M74:
https://storage.googleapis.com/chromium-find-releases-static/dd7.html#dd76bcf7a89662980115900ad7c9acc97caaec33
items.title: Remove PaymentAddress's languageCode property

items.content_html:
The main update is this change in WebKit main version 612.1.24:
WebKit/WebKit@1ee3764
https://github.com/WebKit/WebKit/blob/1ee37646d48f3b7a829a328b37d1af411d287869/Source/WebCore/Configurations/Version.xcconfig

That maps to Safari/iOS 15.

Remove the entry on CryptoKey as redundant.

Also use "mirror" in some places where differences are implausible.
items.title: Update "Secure context required" for Web Crypto API

items.content_html:
This matches the data for crypto.subtle.generateKey() and importKey(),
the APIs that create CryptoKey instances.

Note that this is probably wrong, but done for consistency.

The initial implementations of importKey() and generateKey() were in
WebKit trunk version 538.5:
WebKit/WebKit@a834b36
https://github.com/WebKit/WebKit/blob/a834b36c558ddbefad9fad00a77d2732a47932ea/Source/WebCore/Configurations/Version.xcconfig
WebKit/WebKit@f656051
https://github.com/WebKit/WebKit/blob/f656051c47f9c9cbab013808f690b75241897709/Source/WebCore/Configurations/Version.xcconfig

That would be Safari/iOS 8.

There's a collector test for this as well:
https://mdn-bcd-collector.appspot.com/tests/api/CryptoKey?exposure=Window

Support is in Safari 7.1 and iOS 8, but not iOS 7. That also suggests
Safari/iOS 8/8 would be more correct. This is a possible follow-up.
items.title: Update Safari support for CryptoKey

items.content_html:
These are media element events already represented on HTMLMediaElement.

Add spec URLs for all media element events while in the area.
items.title: Remove loadstart/loadeddata/loadedmetadata events from GlobalEventHandlers

items.content_html:
FF supports a number of Intl.NumberFormat items in nightly from https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1648137

This includes:

  • Intl.NumberFormat.formatRange()
  • Intl.NumberFormat.formatRangeToParts()
  • Intl.PluralRules.selectRange()

  1. I'm getting errors Error → Experimental should be set to false for as the feature is supported in multiple browser engines.
    @queengooborg Is that correct? I.e. does preview count as a supported platform? Seems premature?

  2. I need advice on this:

  • Intl.NumberFormat.NumberFormat() constructor option - useGrouping (subfeature options_useGrouping_parameter).
    • This is incorrectly marked as new and experimental. Actually what has happened in the proposal is that this was a boolean (true, false) and now additionally takes: min2, auto (default), always, undefined.
    • Proposal - make the existing options_useGrouping_parameter reflect "true" false, and add a new one options_useGrouping_parameter_numberformat_v3 or options_useGrouping_parameter_ecma402 - what do you suggest?
    • Note, I don't propose to change Intl.NumberFormat.prototype.resolvedOptions() which might return these values, because it is in terms of the options passed in. So the fact that it might return different options changes nothing.
  1. I need advice on this:

The NumberFormat.format() method has existed for ages. Previously it took a string and treated this as a Number. Now it treats it as a "Decimal". Essentially a passthrough for formatting that doesn't lose precision, as shown here: https://github.com/tc39/proposal-intl-numberformat-v3#interpret-strings-as-decimals-ecma-402-334

I would like to create a subfeature string_as_decimal (unless you have a better name) for this. OK?
items.title: NumberFormat/PluralRules updates

items.content_html:
This originates from a review comment from @MattiasBuelens (readable byte stream spec author) in mdn/content#16818 (comment)<

As of whatwg/streams#1168, this is no longer a requirement. When calling releaseLock(), any outstanding read requests will now be immediately rejected, and a new reader can be acquired later on to read the remaining chunks.
Note that, at the time of writing, only Firefox has implemented this spec change. Other browsers still throw when calling releaseLock() while there are pending reads.

So in essence, from FF102 firefox obeys the spec and rejects pending read requests if releaseLock is called on a reader while there are pending requests. Other browsers will throw in releaseLock().

What I have tried to do here is capture that in a releaseLock() subfeature reject_pending_read_request adding a note for chrome about the old behaviour. It might be better as a subfeature one level up releaseLock_reject_pending_read_request - appreciate your guidance @queengooborg .
items.title: FF102 readable stream releaseLock() rejects pending read requests

items.content_html:
Summary

Correct support data for gamepad(dis)connected_event

Mark Safari support as partial due to it missing the window attributes.

Change Firefox support until version 89 to be partial for the same reason.

Test results and supporting details

https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=223860 - shows the window attributes have only just been implemented in WebKit so can't be in a Safari release.

https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1697093 - shows the window attributes were implemented in Firefox 89.

Related issues
items.title: Correct support data for gamepad(dis)connected_event
